TopicTitle: [1.0.4][Kopernicus]KerbolPlus v.2.3.9 - a planet pack that ads the legendary Gas Planet 2 and more.

Articles.Content: Again, I cannot send you private messages due to your inbox being full. I advise you to delete at least ten old messages, or else this problem will re-appear in no-time.

Faz currently does look quite interesting though... it's a mystery...

some pages ago i reported this texture error on faz. It can be fixed by editing the FAZ.cfg file. Add this template block at the start so it looks like this. 

> 
> @Kopernicus:AFTER[Kopernicus]
> {
> 
>  Body
> 
>  {
> 
>  name = Faz
> 
>  flightGlobalsIndex = 50
> 
>  **Template**
> 
>  **{**
> 
>  **name = Eeloo**
> 
>  **removePQSMods = PQSMod\_AltitudeAlpha, PQSMod\_VertexHeightNoise, PQSMod\_VertexSimplexHeightMap, PQSMod\_VertexHeightMap**
> 
>  **}**
> 
>  Orbit
> 
>  {

It is still a bit weared, on map and far away faz looks purple, but when you come close it switches to gray-ish. 

I still sunk in the ground on my first landing, it was near the poles of faz. Landing around the equator is working ok.

realy strange... Just copy all paramiters from Fonso to Faz except the paths to textures adn orbital and name characteristics. Dwarf Planets and Keelon Moons packs are bugged because I have done to many changes to them in 2.4.0 to be able to use them for outedated planets. Sorry.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Does Corolet use Kopernicus Expansion for it's tail now? Because if it does, instant install into my game.

It does. In 2.4.0 the trail is also improved so it is visible from Kerbin.
Lookingforward to 2.4.0, it sounds amazing.

> 
> Lookingforward to 2.4.0, it sounds amazing.

 It is amazing! Today I put the finishing touches on Keelon's moons and started to work again on the Sarvin System. Potatus now no longer uses height maps, is mostly proceduraly generated, a bit oblate, and has the cryovolcano centered better. Oh, and the cryovolcano now also uses Kopernicus, getting rid of the Kittopia Tech dependency. The cryovolcano is a separate object from the planet textures themselves, so I have moare control over it, like size and deformity. 

BTW the cryovolcano object works the same way as KSC's flat landmass, in fact using a PQS mod called PQSMod\_MapDecal.

 I also made Sarvin appear as main menu planet instead of Kerbin. Unforcenately, due to some strange bug, Fonso's (now also proceduraly generated) surface became intense orange and the ground textures were loading with extreme dificulty so that means I'll have to remake it yet again till it works good!

After I also finish remaking the Sarvin System part, I'll start making the Dwarf Planets. After that I am thinking of making some basic edits to the stock solar system, like make the Kerbin, Eve and Duna barycentric with their moons like they would be in real life. 

Happy Halloween everybody!

Oh, and If I have some spare time I might look over the current hotfix so I fix as many bugs as I can.
Fixed Fonso taday! Now it has a brand new surface with interesting proceduraly generated landforms.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-03T03:32:04Z" title="11/03/2015 03:32  AM" data-short="8 yr">November 3, 2015</time> by Ateballgaming**

Well...

1. K+ is not fully compatible with other planet packs so problems might occur. Kerbal Galaxy messes with the sun to make it a black hole and creates a new sun for the stock planets to orbit. Tehnicaly, the black hole is still internaly named Sun, so Kerbol Plus thinks that it needs to orbit the black hole, because tehnicaly, it is the parrent body planets in K+ orbit normaly without the sun being messed with. K+ 2.4.0 (Christmas) will add science compatibility and other mods intergration so you should be clear.

2. You might have not installed the mod correctly. Make sure that you have the Kopernicus, ModuleManager, KerbolPlus and Kerbal expansion folders in your GameData.

> 
> Can someone please explain what i did wrong?
> I installed the mod today (And the kerbal galaxy mod, ill explain later) and when i booted up eeloo was gone. I zoomed out a bit more to see the other systems the kerbal galaxy 2 mod gave me, but to my surprise all the planets kerbol plus mod added were orbiting the black hole the galaxy mod added and there were no other solar systems around.
>

> 
> Screenshots can be seen here, there the top 2.

> [http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198136305784/screenshots/](http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198136305784/screenshots/)

> figured it out and fully deleted the galaxy mod, however whenever i start my game up with the kerbol plus mod, it crashes the second it loads ksc.
> 
> Is this a mod problem or am i doing something wrong?

You can use K+ together with KG2, though it is not recommended. I can explain how to make the two compatible though:

1. K+ planets orbiting the black hole

Solution: open the configs of the K+ planets, scroll to the orbital properties and set the parentbody to 'Kerbol', or whatever the stock sun is named in KG2. Remember: ONLY the K+ (dwarf)planets that are orbiting the black hole, don't touch the moons!

2. Eeloo vanishing

Solution: this is simply because KG2 has a config that places Eeloo around the new stock Sun, while K+ also has a config that moves Eeloo. In the K+ configs, delete Eeloo.cfg and it should show up. The problem is that Kopernicus gets the following information (not literally, this is merely a highly simplified version):

KG2: Kopernicus, place Eeloo around a new stock sun called 'Kerbol'

K+: Kopernicus, place Eeloo around a new planet named 'Sarvin'

Since Kopernicus can't move Eeloo to orbit both Kerbol and Sarvin, it errors when trying to place Eeloo and therefor Eeloo can't be loaded and disappears entirely.

Hope this helps,

TWG

K+ 2.4.0 (Christmas) will add science compatibility and other mods intergration so you should be clear.

> 2. You might have not installed the mod correctly. Make sure that you have the Kopernicus, ModuleManager, KerbolPlus and Kerbal expansion folders in your GameData.
